alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Fayette; Hocking; Pickaway (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 06 at 2:45AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of Central Ohio and West Central Ohio, including the following counties, in Central Ohio, Delaware, Fairfield, Fayette OH, Franklin OH, Hocking, Licking, Madison, Pickaway and Union OH. In West Central Ohio, Auglaize, Champaign, Clark, Darke, Greene, Hardin, Logan, Mercer, Miami, Montgomery, Preble and Shelby. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Repeated rounds of thunderstorms will result in rainfall of 2 to 4 inches with locally higher amounts.
info.instruction: People in the watch area should keep an eye on the weather and be prepared for immediate action should heavy rains and flooding occur or a Flash Flood Warning be issued. Avoid low-lying areas and be careful when approaching highway dips and underpasses.
